intro: Gurania dugandii, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its fruits are berry-like and contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
